extraction_metadata.article_title: When does a freemium business model lead to high performance? — A qualitative comparative analysis based on fuzzy Sets

extracted_data.question_text: What is the name and definition of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Freemium Business Model. Definition: An emerging business model that combines 'free' and 'premium,' offering a free basic version of the product and a fully paid version. It creates value with free products and then adds more value through premium sales or fragmented upsell products. Two main types: Bundled freemium (business adds value through premium sales with interrelated features bundled together) and Fragmented freemium (creates value with free products then adds value with many fragmented upsell products that can be sold separately).
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3, Section 2.1: 'As an emerging business model, the freemium business model has received considerable attention from business research in recent years. Freemium combines "free" and "premium," i.e., offering a free basic version of the product and a fully paid version.' | Page 7, Table 3: 'The business adds more value through one (or several) premium sales (from which it gets value)' (bundled) | 'The company creates value with free products and then adds more value with many "fragmented" upsell products' (fragmented)

extracted_data.question_text: What synonyms or alternative terms are used in the article to refer to this software business model?
extracted_value: freemium
freemium business model
bundled freemium business model
fragmented freemium business model
freemium model
freemium strategy
freemium offerings
extracted_data.source_citation: Throughout the article, these terms are used interchangeably, including Page 3 'freemium strategy', Page 3 'freemium offerings', etc.

extracted_data.question_text: What is the main vertical segment or industry where the software business model presented in the article is applied?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Mobile applications - including meeting apps, e-commerce, video, music, gaming, social media, navigation, and digital services
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Abstract: 'data from 45 freemium business model apps' | Page 3, Section 2.1: 'Freemium business models are popular among digital platform companies in categories including mobile app stores and video games' | Page 5, Table 1: Lists apps including 'Tencent meeting, Pinduoduo, Meituan, Taobao, NetEase Cloud Music, Arena of Valor, Bilibili' covering various categories

extracted_data.question_text: Which Business Model Canvas elements are detailed in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: Value Proposition: Two types - Bundled freemium (adds value through premium sales with bundled features, new product/service combinations, interrelated reinforcing characteristics) and Fragmented freemium (creates value with free products then adds value with many fragmented upsell products that can be sold separately, modular customization based on customer interests)
Customer Segment: Free users and paid/premium users; users willing to try free products; users who upgrade based on interests and willingness to pay
Channels: Apple App Store and digital platforms; free app charts; direct digital distribution
Relationship: Network effects to increase user base; conversion from free to paid users; advertising relationships; user retention
Revenue Streams: Premium upgrades from freemium users; subscription revenue from paying subscribers; advertising sponsorship revenue from basic subscribers; separately priced features/services
Key Resources: User base; free product offering; premium features/modules; digital platform infrastructure; data for analytics
Key Activities: Enhancing network effects; converting free users to paid users; increasing user retention; business model innovation; value creation and value capture; modular product development
Key Partnerships: Advertisers (for ad-sponsored revenue); platform providers (Apple App Store)
Cost Structure: not detailed in article
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3, Section 2.1 describes value proposition and revenue models | Page 7, Table 3 details specific value proposition characteristics for bundled and fragmented models | Page 3 describes customer segments and relationships | Page 5 describes channels through App Store

extracted_data.question_text: Which actors participate in the ecosystem of the software business model presented in the article and how do they interact?

extracted_value.role: Base users who adopt free product version and benefit from network effects
extracted_value.interaction_with_offering_company: Try free products to alleviate uncertainty; may convert to paid users; provide user base for network effects
extracted_value.interaction_with_other_actors: Contribute to network effects that benefit all users; exposed to advertising

extracted_value.role: Users who upgrade to premium features through subscription or purchases
extracted_value.interaction_with_offering_company: Pay for premium upgrades, subscription fees, or separately priced features based on interests and willingness to pay; generate primary revenue
extracted_value.interaction_with_other_actors: Benefit from larger user base created by free users

extracted_value.role: Third-party companies seeking to reach the user base
extracted_value.interaction_with_offering_company: Pay advertising sponsorship revenue to reach basic subscribers; benefit from enhanced network effects that increase user size

extracted_value.role: Marketplace and distribution platform for apps
extracted_value.interaction_with_offering_company: Provides environment where apps coexist and compete; enables distribution through free and paid charts

extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3, Section 2.1: 'firms traded off between increasing the number of paying subscribers to gain subscription revenue and increasing the number of basic subscribers to gain advertising sponsorship revenue' | 'it increases the conversion rate of free users to paid users by enhancing network effects' | 'it benefits advertisers by increasing the free user base through enhanced network effects' | Page 5: 'The Apple App provides an environment where paid and free apps coexist, competing with each other for the same user resources and attention'

extracted_data.question_text: What motivations lead to the adoption of the software business model presented in the article?
extracted_value: Increase size of user base and benefit from network effects
Alleviate uncertainty associated with digital products for users
Increase user retention rate
Generate revenue from both subscription and advertising
Lower entry barriers for users (free trial)
Combat piracy by offering free legal alternative
Benefit from data-driven learning and user behavior analysis
Create multiple revenue streams (paid users and advertisers)
Achieve high performance and competitive advantage
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 3, Section 2.1: 'It is often used by companies that are trying to increase the size of their user base and benefit from network effects' | 'users are more willing to try free products to alleviate the uncertainty associated with digital products. Freemium models increase a company's user retention rate and alleviate the uncertainty of digital products for users' | 'firms traded off between increasing the number of paying subscribers to gain subscription revenue and increasing the number of basic subscribers to gain advertising sponsorship revenue' | Page 3: 'scholars have examined its effectiveness in the context of piracy'

extracted_data.question_text: What factors contribute to the success of the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: High sensing capability → Perceives new opportunities, customer needs changes, competitor behavior → Achieves high performance
High seizing capability → Clear roles in acquiring resources/knowledge, learning from mistakes, obtaining quality resources at lower cost → Achieves high performance
High reconfiguring capability → Adjusts resource mix according to environmental changes, effective departmental collaboration, designs feasible solutions → Achieves high performance under uncertainty
Bundled freemium model + sensing capability → Critical combination even without other factors → Achieves high performance
Fragmented freemium model + all three dynamic capabilities → Under high environmental uncertainty → Achieves high performance
Network effects enhancement → Amplifies leader's advantage, increases user base and conversion rates → Higher profitability
Combination of bundled and fragmented models → Complementary relationship rather than substitution → Higher performance
Modular customization based on customer interests → Allows flexible upsells → Better value capture
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 11, Section 5.1: 'For companies with bundled and fragmented freemium business models, high sensing and seizing capabilities are critical to achieving high performance' | 'A high bundled freemium business model, high sensing capability, and a lack of fragmented freemium business models and seizing capability can lead to high performance, regardless of reconfiguration capabilities and environmental uncertainty' | 'Under high environmental uncertainty, offering fragmented freemium business models with or without a bundled freemium business model will lead to high performance if they have high sensing, seizing, and reconfiguring capabilities' | Page 3: 'enhanced network effects amplify the leader's advantage over followers, increasing the user base and increasing conversion rates'

extracted_data.question_text: What prerequisites or conditions are necessary for the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Dynamic capabilities → Sensing, seizing, and/or reconfiguring capabilities required for freemium models to lead to high performance
User base of sufficient size → Freemium products must attract disproportionately large user base to generate revenue
Network effects potential → Ability to benefit from increased user base
Free product offering → Must provide valuable free version to attract users
Premium features/modules → Must have differentiated paid features worth upgrading to
Digital platform infrastructure → Ability to deliver and distribute digitally
Ability to enhance network effects → Critical for conversion and user retention
Organizational readiness for innovation → Required for business model innovation
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2, Section 1: 'Compared to paid products, freemium products must attract a disproportionately large user base to generate revenue and capture value' | Page 2: 'Freemium business models require dynamic capabilities and hypothesizes that higher performance can be achieved when freemium business models, dynamic capabilities, and environmental uncertainty interact' | Page 11: 'Bundled and fragmented freemium business models are a fundamental driver of enterprise performance and are necessary to bring about high enterprise performance, but they can only work in combination with dynamic capabilities and environmental uncertainty'

extracted_data.question_text: What restrictions or incompatibilities are mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: Privacy concerns → Consumers perceive digital-intelligent technologies make privacy riskier and doubt privacy security of free products → Detrimental to performance
Bundled model difficulty → Difficult for company to separate high-quality functions and sell them separately (characteristic of bundled model)
Fragmented model complexity → Free products are complex and require modular purchase capability; purchased products are depleted after use
Resource requirements → Bundled models require providing new combinations of products/services and novel incentives which is challenging under high environmental uncertainty
Conversion challenge → Only small percentage of freemium users spend money on premium upgrades
User base size requirement → Must attract disproportionately large user base compared to paid products
Environmental uncertainty trade-off → Fragmented models perform better under high uncertainty while bundled models face challenges balancing efficiency and novelty
Lack of dynamic capabilities → Without high sensing, seizing capabilities, even bundled and fragmented models lead to non-high performance
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2, Section 1: 'research has shown that consumers perceive that digital-intelligent technologies make privacy riskier and doubt the privacy security of free products, which in turn is detrimental to performance' | 'Compared to paid products, freemium products must attract a disproportionately large user base to generate revenue and capture value' | Page 7, Table 3: 'It is difficult for the company to separate high-quality functions and sell them separately' | 'The purchased products offered by the business are depleted after use' | Page 12: 'bundled freemium business models require firms to provide new combinations of products and services, new value propositions, and novel incentives to transaction participants, which makes it challenging for firms to balance efficiency and novelty enhancement under high environmental uncertainty'

extracted_data.question_text: What challenges are identified in implementing the software business model as presented in the article?
extracted_value: Understanding when freemium leads to high performance - unclear whether influence is greater in volatile market or technological environments
Achieving sufficient conversion rate - small percentage of freemium users actually spend money on premium upgrades with significant differences in spending amounts
Balancing two revenue streams - trade-off between increasing paying subscribers for subscription revenue vs. increasing basic subscribers for advertising revenue
Privacy concerns - consumers doubt privacy security of free products which harms performance
Differentiated performance outcomes - most apps use freemium but show strong contrasts in performance (success vs. failure)
Attracting disproportionately large user base - requirement to generate sufficient revenue compared to paid products
Managing complexity - understanding how freemium business models, dynamic capabilities, and environmental uncertainty interact
Avoiding non-high performance - lack of high sensing and seizing capabilities can lead to non-high performance even with freemium models
Balancing efficiency and novelty under uncertainty - bundled models face challenges providing new combinations while maintaining efficiency in dynamic environments
Preventing user perception issues - managing uncertainty associated with digital products
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Introduction: 'Most apps use freemium business models... Renren, Shrimp Music, QQ Farm and WeChat, NetEase Cloud, Arena of Valor, and other apps show strong contrasts in performances' | 'The success mode of the freemium business model lies in a small percentage of freemium users spending money on premium upgrades, and there are significant differences in the amount of money spent by freemium users' | Page 2: 'research has shown that consumers perceive that digital-intelligent technologies make privacy riskier and doubt the privacy security of free products, which in turn is detrimental to performance' | 'It is unclear whether the influence of the freemium business model on high performance is greater in volatile market environments or technological environments' | Page 3: 'firms traded off between increasing the number of paying subscribers to gain subscription revenue and increasing the number of basic subscribers to gain advertising sponsorship revenue'

extracted_data.question_text: What practices are used to mitigate challenges of the software business model as described in the article?
extracted_value: Develop high sensing capability → Mitigates opportunity identification challenge → Perceives new opportunities, customer needs changes, competitor behavior for high performance
Develop high seizing capability → Addresses resource acquisition challenge → Obtains high-quality resources at lower cost, clear roles in acquiring knowledge for high performance
Develop high reconfiguring capability → Mitigates environmental change challenge → Adjusts resource mix according to changes, enables high performance under uncertainty
Enhance network effects → Addresses user base and conversion challenges → Amplifies leader's advantage, increases conversion rates and user retention
Use bundled + fragmented combination → Mitigates single model limitations → Complementary relationship creates multiple value creation and capture mechanisms
Modular product design → Addresses customization challenge → Allows users to choose upsells based on interests and willingness to pay
Focus on sensing for bundled models → Critical for bundled freemium success → Enables discovery of new opportunities and business model innovations
Focus on all three capabilities for fragmented models under uncertainty → Addresses environmental dynamism → High sensing, seizing, reconfiguring capabilities enable adaptation
Data-driven learning → Addresses uncertainty challenge → Analyze large data to identify behavior patterns and improve offering accuracy
Free trial strategy → Mitigates digital product uncertainty → Allows users to try products and alleviate uncertainty before committing
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2: 'companies use techniques such as machine learning to analyze large amounts of data to identify patterns of past behavior modes to predict and improve the accuracy of their offerings' | Page 3: 'Freemium models increase a company's user retention rate and alleviate the uncertainty of digital products for users' | Page 11, Section 5.1: 'For companies with bundled and fragmented freemium business models, high sensing and seizing capabilities are critical to achieving high performance' | 'Under high environmental uncertainty, offering fragmented freemium business models with or without a bundled freemium business model will lead to high performance if they have high sensing, seizing, and reconfiguring capabilities' | Page 12: 'The bundled freemium business model and the fragmented freemium business model are complementary rather than substitutes'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the temporal period and maturity of the software business model as presented in the article?
extracted_data.extracted_value: Observed period: 2009-2022 data collection period, with article received July 2023, accepted January 2024. Maturity status: Consolidated - Freemium model has grown from 25% of Apple App Store in 2009 to over 80% in 2022, demonstrating widespread adoption and maturity.
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Introduction: 'the share of freemium apps on the Apple App Store rose from 25 % in 2009 to over 80 % in 2022. Additionally, App Store subscriptions increased from 745 million in 2021 to 900 million in 2022.' | Page 3, Section 2.1: 'As an emerging business model, the freemium business model has received considerable attention from business research in recent years' | Page 1: 'Received 4 July 2023; Received in revised form 17 January 2024; Accepted 22 January 2024'

extracted_data.question_text: What is the type of evidence presented in the article about the software business model?
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 1, Abstract: 'data from 45 freemium business model apps' | Page 5, Section 3.2: 'Forty-five randomly sampled data points from the free list in the App Store are used as samples, where each app is used as a sample point, and 45 sample cases are finally determined' | 'The description of each case is about 35 pages long (300,000–500,000 words), thus providing qualitative data about freemium business models' | Page 2, Section 1: 'fuzzy set qualitative comparative analysis (fsQCA) approach was used to test the conceptual model with data from 45 freemium business model apps'

Tencent Conference has a bundled freemium business model app, whose functional modules are bundled and sold' | Page 5, Table 1: Complete list of 45 case apps | Page 10: 'Tencent Meeting, an app, focuses more on improving sensing and seizing capability' | Page 11: 'Arena of Valor brings high value-added revenue to the company due to its fragmented freemium model'

extracted_data.question_text: Are there variations or subtypes of the software business model described in the article?
extracted_value: Bundled Freemium Business Model → Business adds value through premium sales with bundled features; new product/service combinations; interrelated and reinforcing characteristics; difficult to separate high-quality functions; users often combine use of hypermodularity

Fragmented Freemium Business Model → Creates value with free products then adds many fragmented upsell products; diverse product features sold separately; users choose upsells by interests and willingness to pay; purchased products depleted after use; free products are complex and support modular purchases
Configuration H1 → Bundled + Fragmented + High Sensing + High Seizing (without Reconfiguring)
Configuration H2 → Bundled + Fragmented + High Sensing + High Seizing + Environmental Uncertainty (without Reconfiguring)
Configuration H3 → Fragmented + High Sensing + High Seizing + High Reconfiguring + Environmental Uncertainty (without/with Bundled)
Configuration H4 → Bundled + High Sensing (without Fragmented and Seizing)
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 2, Section 1: 'We divide the freemium business model into bundled and fragmented business models' | Page 7, Table 3: Detailed definitions of bundled and fragmented characteristics | Page 9, Table 6: Shows four configurations (H1-H4) for achieving high performance with different combinations

extracted_data.question_text: What future trends or evolutions are mentioned in the article about the software business model?
extracted_value: Need for larger sample size research → Future research recommended to explore more factors and verify findings with larger samples
Incorporation of entrepreneurship configuration effects → Based on top-echelon theory, future research should explore TMT perceptions and entrepreneurship influence on performance
Control variables expansion → Future research should address lack of control variables to enable generalization to other circumstances
Investigation of other freemium contexts → Whether success paths differ for other freemium business model apps beyond studied sample needs investigation
Integration of realistic factors → TMT perceptions and entrepreneurship may influence performance and should be incorporated
Data-driven learning advancement → Companies will increasingly use machine learning to analyze large data amounts to identify patterns and improve offerings
Continued growth of freemium adoption → Based on growth from 25% to 80% of App Store, continued expansion expected
extracted_data.source_citation: Page 13, Section 6: 'Therefore, future research is recommended to have a larger sample size to explore more factors.' | 'In the future, the configuration effect of entrepreneurship can be incorporated based on the top-echelon theory.' | 'Secondly, the lack of control variables limits the possibility of summarizing the results in other circumstances.' | 'First, the case sample used in this study is 45 apps from the free list of the Apple App Store, and whether the success paths of other freemium business model apps to achieve high performance present different characteristics needs to be further investigated.' | 'Last, realistic factors such as TMT perceptions and entrepreneurship may influence performance.'
